snippet: Investment banks involved in the latest deals, including Goldman and a newcomer Robey Warshaw, stand to gain windfalls if the latest mergers close.
abstract: When major merger deals involving Royal Dutch Shell and BG Group and Mylan and Perrigo close, investment banks that acted as advisers on deals will see major windfalls; Goldman Sachs in particular stands to profit enormously, as it was involved in both deals, firmly cementing its lead in rankings of merger advisers.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: Investment banks involved in the latest deals, including Goldman and a newcomer Robey Warshaw, stand to gain windfalls if the latest mergers close.

headline.main: A Rich Day for Banks Advising on Big Merger Deals
headline.print_headline: Day of Blockbuster Deals Enriches the Fortunes of the Advising Banks
